description: From nun +‎ -ation, after Arabic تَنْوِين‎ (tanwīn), verbal noun of نَوَّنَ‎ (nawwana, literally “to nunate, nunify”), derived from the letter name نُون‎ (nūn). See nun (“Semitic letter”).

entries.meaning: The use of a suffix ("-n") signifying a lack of syntactical definiteness of the noun or adjective in standard Arabic. It is written as a diacritic over the final letter.
The use of a suffix ("-n") in dual forms in Akkadian.
